Legal_Issue: Whether the Respondent met the residency requirement under section 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Basis_of_Claim: Failure to meet minimum residency requirement
Key_Factor_in_Determination: 774 days of absence from Canada within four-year period
Review_Outcome: Decision quashed due to legal error and insufficient rationale
Assessment_Standard: Objective assessment of physical presence and residential ties
Evidence_Ignored: Potential evidence supporting residency not adequately considered
Legal_Standard: Statutory residency requirement of at least 3 years in Canada within 4 years prior to application
Application_Factor: Length and pattern of absences from Canada
Decision_Review_Issue: Correctness of legal interpretation and adequacy of reasons
Cause_of_Refusal: Failure to meet statutory residency requirement
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient explanation of how residency was established despite prolonged absence
Procedural_Fairness: Inadequate reasons provided by decision maker
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Respondent argued residency through connections, but failed established tests
Omission_Type: Failure to properly apply legal test for residency
